metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10803 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In phpMyAdmin 4.x before 4.9.5 and 5.x before 5.0.2, a SQL injectionvulnerability was discovered where malicious code could be used to triggeran XSS attack through retrieving and displaying results (intbl_get_field.php and libraries/classes/Display/Results.php). The attackermust be able to insert crafted data into certain database tables, whichwhen retrieved (for instance, through the Browse tab) can trigger the XSSattack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10803` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.6-5ubuntu0.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.6-5ubuntu0.5').
